reviews.review_msg: Rosemary is passionate about the subject and easily accessible by email/office hours if you have any questions - course content was interesting too. Lots of assignments but reasonable for a W course

Rosemary is an amazing Professor and person! Idk why anyone would give her less than 5 stars. This class was probably the most inspirational class I have taken in my university experience leading me to explore more topics on decolonization and what it means. She tries very hard to learn each students name and gives good feedback to answers. i <3 u

Rosemary is such a wonderful human being! It's a W class, so be prepared for lots of reading and writing. But she's always accessible if you need extra help, and gives good feedback for ideas and writing (along with the TA's). Super inspirational class, and would love to take more geography classes with her!

I was genuinely excited about the content of this course, but there really could not be a worse man to teach it. Grading expectations are extremely unclear, even the ASSIGNMENT instructions are not clear. You have no idea how you're being graded. Though I will admit he was pretty lenient on deadlines, but that probably was because of covid

Assignment expectations are unclear and he wont clarify when asked. Wont provide rubrics. Doesnt keep his office hours. Doesnt answer emails. Doesnt understand basic science. Marks based on if you agree with his opinions. Clearly only cares about his work for the Parks Board not teaching. This course is frustrating and I learned nothing.

If I could give a 0 I would. John is a nice guy I guess, but he gets a lot of science facts wrong and tried to argue that carbon capturing and advancing farming tech to be more sustainable where morally wrong and bad. Won't give you a grade above 90% because being above that means he could have wrote it himself. Don't take. Avoid at all costs. Run.

I had John for 2 courses last semester(GEOG 100 and GEOG 389. Lectures are  dull but he's a  nice guy. Once you get used to his teaching style you'll notice he tries to be funny at times, and he actually knows a lot about what is going on in the world. Lectures are recorded, but slides are not available. Oh and the finals were fair/easy.

To those who complain about him not giving out ppt for notes, learn to take notes scrubs. Do your readings and pay attention to the concepts not all the finest details. Don't complain, he's a fair marker and is informative. Follow his guidelines and put effort into the materials. We're not in highschool anymore Toto!
